column4: muzxttt you can refresh the cache from terminal, sudo apt-get update (this refreshes the cache
: i am new to linux and i do run 11.04 in my laptop and just installed 10.04 and did not like how it looks actually i could not get the apps i wanted !!! so can i update it?!
: i am new to linux and i do run 11.04 in my laptop and just installed 10.04 on my home pc and did not like how it looks actually i could not get the apps i wanted !!! so can i update it?! :
you don't need to double post
so you want to update 10.04 to 11.04 ?
: no! i just want to update the 'software center'!!!! is it possible?!
uh well yes and no, you could change the repository that you use
but this isn't really supported and can break your installation
: mmm ... i just want to get other users feedback and the ratings !
you want to get feedback from particular installs ?
i've not had a chance to look 11.04 over so i'm not sure what you guy's software center looks like
: yes along with the ratings which is not supported in the older version of the 'software center'
ahh well updating the software center isn't actually supported in other words you'd be better off updating to 11.04
